snippet: The insistence from the U.S.-backed opposition that President Bashar al-Assad must go before peace talks can begin is said to be outdated, failing to reflect the situation on the ground.
abstract: Growing number of Syrians on both sides of country's conflict are demanding new peace strategy as it becomes increasingly clear that Pres Bashar al-Assad will not step down; some say that opposition's insistence that Assad must resign before negotiations can begin is outdated, and that deal to end or ease violence must involve Assad.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The insistence from the U.S.-backed opposition that President Bashar al-Assad must go before peace talks can begin is said to be outdated, failing to reflect the situation on the ground.

headline.main: Syrians on Both Sides of the War Increasingly See Assad as Likely to Stay
headline.print_headline: Syrians on Both Sides of the War Increasingly See Assad as Likely to Stay
